question: List all drugs in the 'Painkillers' category with a stock below 100 units, along with their supplier names and the date when their inventory was last updated. Order results by oldest inventory update first.
sqlanswer: SELECT DISTINCT D.drug_name, S.supplier_name, I.last_updated FROM drug AS D JOIN inventory AS I ON D(drug_id) = I(drug_id) JOIN supplier AS S ON I(supplier_id) = S(supplier_id) WHERE D.stock < 100 ORDER BY I.last_updated LIMIT 1

question: Identify the top 5 products by total sales amount in the last quarter of 2024, including their category names and the store locations where they were sold. Order the results by total sales amount in descending order.
sqlanswer:
SELECT T1.product_name, T2.category_name, T3.location 
FROM product AS T1 
JOIN category AS T2 ON T1.category_id = T2.category_id
JOIN store AS T3 ON T3.store_id = ( SELECT T4.store_id FROM sales AS T5 WHERE MONTH(T5.sale_date) = 12 AND YEAR(T5.sale_date) = 2024 GROUP BY T5.store_id ORDER BY SUM(T5.total_amount) DESC LIMIT 5 )
GROUP BY T1.product_name, T2.category_name
ORDER BY SUM(T1.price * T1.quantity) DESC

question: Find the top 3 products with the highest average rating from user reviews, including their category names and total sales amounts. Only consider products that have been ordered at least 10 times. Order the results by average rating in descending order.
sqlanswer:
SELECT T3.category_name, CAST(SUM(T2.quantity) AS FLOAT) / COUNT(*) AS average_rating, SUM(T4.total_amount) AS total_sales
FROM review AS T1
JOIN product AS T2 ON T1.product_id = T2.product_id
JOIN category AS T3 ON T2.category_id = T3.category_id
JOIN order_item AS T4 ON T1.product_id = T4.product_id
WHERE (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM order_ WHERE product_id IN (SELECT product_id FROM order_item)) >= 10
GROUP BY T3.category_name, T2.category_id
ORDER BY average_rating DESC LIMIT 3;

question: List all agents who have facilitated sales of properties with a total sale price exceeding $500,000 in the last year. Include their full names, the number of properties sold, and the total commission earned. Order the results by total commission in descending order.
sqlanswer:
SELECT DISTINCT T1.first_name, T1.last_name, COUNT(T2.property_id) AS num_properties_sold, 
       SUM(CASE WHEN T3.sale_price > 500000 THEN T4.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_commission
FROM agent AS T1
JOIN sale AS T2 ON T1.agent_id = T2.agent_id
JOIN commission AS T3 ON T2.sale_id = T3.sale_id
JOIN client AS T4 ON T2.client_id = T4.client_id
GROUP BY T1.first_name, T1.last_name
ORDER BY total_commission DESC;

question: Identify the top 5 products by total sales amount in the last quarter of 2024, including the name of the employee who made the sale and the total quantity sold for each product. Order the results by total sales amount in descending order.
sqlanswer:
SELECT T1.product_name, T2.employee_name, SUM(T3.quantity_sold) AS total_quantity_sold 
FROM sales AS T1 
JOIN employee AS T2 ON T1.employee_id = T2.employee_id 
JOIN product AS T3 ON T1.product_id = T3.product_id 
WHERE T1.sale_date BETWEEN '2024-01-01' AND '2024-03-31'
GROUP BY T1.product_name, T2.employee_name
ORDER BY SUM(T3.quantity_sold) DESC
LIMIT 5

question: Retrieve the first name of customers who have given a 5-star rating to a restaurant and have also placed at least one order at that restaurant. For each such customer-restaurant pair, also retrieve the name of the restaurant and the total amount the customer has spent at that restaurant.
sqlanswer: SELECT T1.first_name, T3.name, SUM(T5.subtotal) FROM customer AS T1 JOIN order_ AS T2 ON T1.customer_id = T2.customer_id JOIN restaurant AS T3 ON T3.restaurant_id = T2.restaurant_id JOIN menu_item AS T4 ON T4.item_id = T2.item_id JOIN order_detail AS T5 ON T5.order_id = T2.order_id WHERE T2.rating = 5 GROUP BY T1.first_name, T3.name

question: Retrieve the first and last name of customers who have purchased a vehicle and also requested a service for that same vehicle, along with the model of the vehicle and the total cost of all services for that vehicle.
sqlanswer:
SELECT T1.first_name, T1.last_name, T2.model, COALESCE(SUM(T3.cost), 0) AS total_cost 
FROM customer T1 
JOIN sale T2 ON T1.customer_id = T2.customer_id 
JOIN service T3 ON T2.vehicle_id = T3.vehicle_id 
WHERE T3.service_date IS NOT NULL 
GROUP BY T1.first_name, T1.last_name, T2.model 
ORDER BY total_cost DESC LIMIT 1;

question: List all drugs in the 'Painkillers' category with a stock below 100 units, along with their supplier names and the date when their inventory was last updated. Order results by oldest inventory update first.
sqlanswer:
```sql
SELECT
  D.drug_name,
  S.supplier_name,
  I.last_updated
FROM drug AS D
JOIN inventory AS I
  ON D.drug_id = I.drug_id
JOIN supplier AS S
  ON I.supplier_id = S.supplier_id
WHERE
  D.category_id = (

```

question: Identify the top 5 products by total sales amount in the last quarter of 2024, including their category names and the store locations where they were sold. Order the results by total sales amount in descending order.
sqlanswer:
```sql
SELECT
  p.product_name,
  c.category_name,
  s.location
FROM product AS p
JOIN category AS c
  ON p.category_id = c.category_id
JOIN sale_items AS si
  ON p.product_id = si.product_id
JOIN sales AS s
  ON si.sale_id = s.sale_id
JOIN store AS s1
  ON s.store_id = s1.store_id
WHERE
  s.sale_date BETWEEN '2024-12-01' AND '2024-12-31'
GROUP BY
  p.product_id
ORDER BY
  SUM(si.quantity * p.price) DESC
LIMIT 5;
```

question: Find the top 3 products with the highest average rating from user reviews, including their category names and total sales amounts. Only consider products that have been ordered at least 10 times. Order the results by average rating in descending order.
sqlanswer:
```sql
SELECT
  p.product_name,
  c.category_name,
  AVG(r.rating) AS average_rating,
  SUM(oi.quantity * p.price) AS total_sales_amount
FROM product AS p
JOIN category AS c
  ON p.category_id = c.category_id
JOIN review AS r
  ON p.product_id = r.product_id
JOIN order_item AS oi
  ON p.product_id = oi.product_id
JOIN user AS u
  ON oi.order_id = u.user_id
GROUP BY
  p.product_id
HAVING
  COUNT(DISTINCT oi.order_id) >= 10
ORDER BY
  average_rating DESC
LIMIT 3;
```

question: Retrieve the first name of customers who have given a 5-star rating to a restaurant and have also placed at least one order at that restaurant. For each such customer-restaurant pair, also retrieve the name of the restaurant and the total amount the customer has spent at that restaurant.
sqlanswer:
```sql
SELECT
  c.first_name AS customer_first_name,
  r.name AS restaurant_name,
  SUM(od.total_amount) AS total_spent
FROM customer AS c
JOIN feedback AS f
  ON c.customer_id = f.customer_id
JOIN restaurant AS r
  ON f.restaurant_id = r.restaurant_id
JOIN order_ AS o
  ON o.customer_id = c.customer_id
JOIN order_detail AS od
  ON od.order_id = o.order_id
WHERE
  f.rating = 5
GROUP BY
  c.customer_id,
  r.restaurant_id
HAVING
  COUNT(DISTINCT o.order_id) > 0;
```

  SUM(p.price * CAST(s.quantity AS FLOAT)) AS total_sales_revenue
FROM salespeople AS s
JOIN sales AS s
  ON s.salesperson_id = s.salesperson_id
JOIN products AS p
  ON s.salesperson_id = s.salesperson_id
GROUP BY
  s.name
ORDER BY
  total_sales_revenue DESC;
